programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: Full Measure with Sharyl Attkisson
programme.desc: Full Measure is an award-winning, weekly national news program, focused on investigative, original, and accountability reporting, and dedicated to pursuing untouchable subjects through fearless journalism. Full Measure, hosted by Emmy-award winning journalist Sharyl Attkisson.

programme.title: 67 Souls: Tragedy Above the Potomac
programme.desc: On January 29, 2025, tragedy struck when an American Airlines flight and a United States Army Sikorsky helicopter collided mid-air over the Potomac River in Washington, D.C., resulting in the deaths of all 67 people on board. The special will pay tribute to the victims as well as provide a mashup of news coverage, press conferences, and interviews with WJLA staff, an aviation expert, and FAA critic, Pete Sepp. In addition, we’ll discuss what we know so far about the ongoing investigation and hear various opinions regarding pilots’ training, air traffic control, and the increase of recent aviation accidents in recent months.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella returns to his favorite hunting grounds of Sonora, Mexico to hunt for a Coues deer buck during the peak rutting season. Steve sets up camp and spends days glassing mountains and canyons for these elusive, wary desert whitetails. Meanwhile, his hunting partner, Remi Warren, attempts the difficult task of stalking one with a bow. To cap off the hunt, Steve cooks a batch of venison ribs braised in a Dutch oven buried beneath hot coals.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In this episode, Steven Rinella joins forces with fellow hunter and wild game chef Hank Shaw in the hills of Central California to go after Columbia blacktail deer, wild pigs, and a handful of small game species that are in season. The end result is a culinary smorgasbord of epic proportions.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Dropped off by bushplane on a remote lakeside in the wilderness of Alaska‚Äôs Brooks Range, Steven Rinella and wildlife biologist Brandt Meixell have ten days of hunting before the plane returns. Big-antlered Yukon moose are few and far between but hard work pays off for hunters who stick with it until the bitter end.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Dropped off by bushplane on a remote lakeside in the wilderness of Alaska‚Äôs Brooks Range, Steven Rinella and wildlife biologist Brandt Meixell have ten days of hunting before the plane returns. Big-antlered Yukon moose are few and far between but hard work pays off for hunters who stick with it until the bitter end.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella has hunted this area before, but he feels he‚Äôs just scratched the surface exploring the surrounding country. The top of the mountain is always calling Steve‚Äôs name, and for this serious Alaskan backpack hunt he‚Äôs bringing along comedians Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen. Cold, wet weather and tough hunting for wily Sitka deer make this a southeast Alaskan adventure these hunters will never forget.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: As the prime cuts are often the first to go, most families are left with a freezer brimming with ground wild game meat. Pulled from the pages of his forthcoming Wild Game Cookbook, Steve shares a variety of recipes from burger to meatloaf and more ‚Äì designed to whittle down this supply and jazz up your ground meat game.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve is fascinated by indigenous people who live in the wilds South America. In this three-part series, he travels deep into the Amazon jungle to hunt with and learn from the locals there. Not only will this be one heck of a hunting adventure, it will be a mind-opening, life-changing event. From bowfishing to hunting in the jungle at night, you never know what the evening‚Äôs menu will bring.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve is fascinated by indigenous people who live in the wilds South America. programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve is fascinated by indigenous people who live in the wilds South America. In this three-part series, he travels deep into the Amazon jungle to hunt with and learn from the locals there. Not only will this be one heck of a hunting adventure, it will be a mind-opening, life-changing event. From bowfishing to hunting in the jungle at night, you never know what the evening‚Äôs menu will bring.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Brittany and Helen have put more work in on MeatEater than just about anyone else, but have yet to hunt a big game animal. Steven Rinella takes them through the process from beginning to end. They need to get their hunters safety, learn to shoot, train for the woods, and get geared up. When November comes they're ready to go, and they strike out into the mountains of northern Montana for the adventure of their lives.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve returns to southern Arizona to stalk the elusive Coues deer. Unaccompanied, Steve immerses himself in the quiet southwest desert and gets intimate with one of the most wary animals in the west. Throughout the hunt, Steve articulates why solo time in trophy country is good for the soul.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve and bird hunting aficionado Ronny Boehme join up with wildlife biologist Ed Arnett in Lubbock, Texas to hunt Sandhill cranes. The Sandhill crane offers a unique wingshooting opportunity and also carries the nickname ‚Äúrib eye of the sky‚Äù because of its supposed similarities to a handsome cut of beef. ¬†It‚Äôs fast action and plenty of laughs as Steve, Ronny, and Ed explore the culinary delights of these birds with a Texas style ‚ÄúCrane Cookout.‚Äù

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Lightning strikes twice: Steven Rinella has somehow beaten the odds and drawn a second Muskox tag after having to forfeit his first one four years ago due to unforeseen circumstances. Steve has always regretted passing up an opportunity to hunt Muskox but with another tag in his pocket, nothing will stop this adventure. We learn about the native history and culture of Nunivak Island's as Steve tries to stay warm while chasing Muskox 30 miles offshore in the Bering Sea.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: The last time Joe Rogan and Bryan Callen went out with Steven Rinella they were soaked head to toe and came home meatless. To remedy their meat crisis while keeping them dry, Steve sets up a springtime wild turkey hunt in sunny California. Steve gives Joe and Bryan the A to Z on hunting, butchering, and cooking the wild turkey. Steve caps off the introductory lesson by preparing his favorite turkey recipe: Schnitzel.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In the first part of this series, Steve attempts a unique spring hunt for sooty grouse in the coastal rainforests of southeast Alaska. These mysterious hooters make for a hunt that is markedly different from any other and success doesn't come easily. They say blind squirrels can find a nut, but will Steve harvest a grouse?

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: In Part One, Steve experienced the difficulty of hunting the Sooty grouse of southeast Alaska. In Part 2, Steve joins his friend Barbara in Juneau who shows him the in and outs of finding ‚Äúhooters.‚Äù Tromping through Southeast Alaska rainforest, Steve and Barbara discover a mutual fondness for an unconventional hunt. Barbara concludes the hunt with a beachside meal of fettuccine a la sooty grouse.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steve loves to fish as much as he loves to hunt.¬†Steve is on a river in SW Montana for a day to catch some rainbow trout and cook a few over a fire. As fishing and campfire cooking offer time for reflection, Steve takes the time to recall a few memorable MeatEater meals.¬†From caveman style sheep ribs in the Alaska Range to curiosity-induced coyote BBQ in Mexico, these meals give Steve the chance to explore what it means to be a MeatEater.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Last spring, Steve decided to pass up an opportunity to kill a black bear in favor of an extended up close and personal experience. This time, Steve heads back to his shack on Prince of Wales Island and he‚Äôs brought his friend Paul Neess from Vortex Optics along to share the experience of using a canoe to slip in close to these giant black bears.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: Steven Rinella charters a float plane to drop off on a remote lake in Alaska‚Äôs coastal rainforest for a solo Sitka blacktail deer hunt. With challenging terrain, thick fog, and incessant rain, finding a buck won't be easy. But if Steve connects on a Sitka blacktail, he'll celebrate with a camp meal of rock-pounded tenderloin.

programme.title: MeatEater
programme.desc: As summer turns to fall, Steve heads into the backcountry of Alaska's Chugach Range. The bears here are on a quest to fatten up on high elevation blueberries before they hibernate for the winter. Steve will need to hike into steep, rugged terrain to find a fat black bear and some of the finest tasting meat available to the American hunter.
